definitions.definition: to no longer have something because you do not know where it is:
to have something or someone taken away from you:
examples: At least 600 staff will lose their jobs if the factory closes.

definitions.definition: to have less of something than you had before:
If you lose time, you waste it:
examples: Four million hours were lost last year through stress-related illnesses.

definitions.definition: If a clock loses time, it goes more slowly than it should:
examples: My watch loses ten minutes every day.
Lose the belt and let's see how the dress looks.

definitions.definition: A business that is losing money is spending more money than it is receiving:
examples: Banks will lose millions of pounds because of new legislation.
